forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 57. West southwest wind around 10 mph.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 63 in the afternoon. West southwest wind 7 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a veil of cloud drapes the city, tinged with the chill of an overnight low settling around 57 degrees. The air carries a refreshing touch, accentuated by a light wind from the west-southwest whispering at around 10 mph. While the fog is not heavy, it dances playfully among the iconic landmarks, granting a gentle mystery to the morning as it slowly begins its retreat.

By midday, the skies will transition to a more inviting, mostly sunny disposition, with temperatures climbing to a comfortable 65 before gently tapering down to about 63 as the afternoon unfolds. The west-southwest breeze will pick up, gusting as high as 22 mph, adding a brisk note to the air. Given these lovely conditions, one might choose comfortably layered attire—a light sweater or jacket, paired with breathable fabrics—perfect for a stroll along the Embarcadero or a leisurely coffee break at a local café. A book or a quiet conversation could seamlessly fit this midday pause, where indulging in the warmth of the sun can gently melt away any lingering gray.
